about.title: Learn a little more about who we are.
about.description: Learn about our mission, who we are, what we do, and why we do it.

team.title: Meet our amazing team that makes this all possible.
team.description: Our team consists of 60 bright and dedicated computer science students – ranging from undergraduates to PhD candidates. With a passion for ensuring that the next generation receives the coding training that they wish they had had, our team is dedicated to making coding fun and relatable while still providing students with the vital real-world skills they’ll need to succeed.

introParagraphs: The Coding School is a 501c3 non-profit that teaches computer programming to elementary and middle school students. We believe that learning how to code is like learning a foreign language, and the earlier students begin learning this new way of thinking, the easier it becomes.

testimonials.author: Ireland N
testimonials.quote: Last school year, at my school, Lincoln Middle School, your company ran two classes on Python and HTML and CSS. I loved them so much and they were so fun that coding is now one of my favorite hobbies. …A dream of mine now, is to take on computer science as a profession...Thanks so much for your time and for creating awesome coding classes.

testimonials.author: Benjamin
testimonials.quote: I didn’t know [what coding was] before this class. I liked how I got to create my own website.

testimonials.author: Angel
testimonials.quote: The best thing about [The Coding School] class is that it was helpful because now I want to become an Engineer.

partnersParagraphs: To ensure quality curriculum and outreach, we are proud to be partnered with these great organizations.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
paragraphs: Our mission is to ensure our children are equipped to thrive in this technologically-driven world.

aboutPage.title: Who We Are
paragraphs: Founded in 2014, The Coding School is a 501c3 non-profit dedicated to equipping children with the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in our tech-driven world.

We teach coding to elementary, middle and high school students so this universal language becomes second nature. We believe that learning how to code is like learning a foreign language, and the earlier students begin learning this new way of thinking, the easier it becomes. However, there is a fundamental disconnect between what students are learning in school and what is happening in the real world.

Whilst growing up through the US education system, founder Kiera Peltz witnessed this disconnect personally. Disappointed in the level of computer science education offered to K-12 students, Kiera researched how other countries were educating their children. She felt the American system was not preparing students for a future where computer language will be the universal language for education, work and play. She sought a way to fix this gap; founding The Coding School in 2014.

aboutPage.title: What We Do
paragraphs: Our team offers long-term coding education with weekly classes as part of a 3-year curriculum.

We at The Coding School believe that coding is a source of empowerment. Yes, we’re training the next generation of coders, but we’re also training the next generation of problem solvers who will become CEOs, politicians, and scientists.

aboutPage.title: Why We Do It
paragraphs: There is a fundamental disconnect between what students are learning in school and what is happening in the real world. The current education system is not preparing students with the necessary critical thinking and computational skills necessary to succeed and address the most pressing issues in the 21st century.
That’s where The Coding School comes in. We aim to bridge this gap.

ourImpact.title: Our Impact
paragraphs: Uniquely, we deliver quality and assured curriculum directly to students in their schools -- regardless of socio-economic status.  This is delivered by passionate experts who live and breath coding and inspire children with the real-world applications.  Our children need to thrive, compete and operate in our ever-increasing tech-driven economy.  We are preparing the minds of children to be thinkers and problem solvers, and perhaps one day one of our students will create the innovation that overcomes a major societal challenge!

heads.description:
Kiera Peltz is a Gates-Cambridge Scholar, pursuing her masters in Political and Economic Sociology at the University of Cambridge. She is a graduate of Brown University, where she received her B.A. in Political Science and Happiness. In Summer 2014, Kiera began learning how to code at the White House as the Innovation & Technology intern in the Office of Presidential Correspondence. Having spent the majority of her free time in high school and college working in political offices, such as U.S. Congressman Brad Sherman and U.S. Senator Sheldon Whitehouse, Kiera is passionate about making computer science education a priority for politicians at the local, state, and federal level. 
Kiera founded The Coding School after she realized the U.S. education system was failing to provide students with the skills needed to tackle the most pressing issues facing society. During her freshman year at Brown University, she was dissuaded from taking any computer science classes because she lacked prior coding knowledge. The following summer, while attending an international conference in Seliger, Russia, she met a group of Estonians, who spoke about the importance of early childhood coding, stating that it’s mandatory for every Estonian, starting at age seven, to learn how to code. Upon returning to the United States, Kiera began critically examining the education system and came to realize that while the world has changed drastically in the past 50 years, our country’s public K-12 curriculum has remained relatively unaltered. So she set out to fix the gap in the education system by creating The Coding School to ensure the next generation learns the language that has built – and will continue to build – the modern world.

board.description: Crystal Hsieh is a fourth-year computer science major at UCLA who cherishes her friends, her family, and her faith. She's had the privilege of interning at Google the past three summers, working in their New York, Mountain View, and Zurich offices. She is also passionate about inspiring the next generation of women techies through developing summer tech camps and teaching coding at local middle schools.

I'm a 2nd year Computer Science student at UCLA. I started programming in high school, where I started a programming club, and never looked back. When I'm not teaching kids with The Coding School, I love doing web development and iOS app development.

teachers.description: I am a freshman Computer Science and Engineering student at UCLA. In high school, I became really interested in computers and taught myself how to build and program an electric car. Besides coding, I love playing basketball, swimming, and watching movies.

I am a Senior studying Computer Science and Business Administration at the University of Southern California. A technology enthusiast, I enjoyed creating applications and websites that help solve real life problems. I hope to bring my passion for education and my self-taught CS experience together to teach programming the most effective way.

I am a current first year computer science major at UCLA and I am excited to further my passion for computer science and hopefully foster an interest in computer science in the next generation of computer science students.

I’m a sophomore studying Computer Science at USC! I’ve been with The Coding School for half a year now and I have a passion for technology that lets users and developers express themselves creatively - i.e. Web Development, VR, etc.

I am a multi-talented individual. My other passions in life are singing and pursuing a healthy lifestyle. I enjoy being active and putting my creative mind to use in technology. I love to seek out new experiences and I enjoy inspiring others to reach for their full potential.
I'm a student attending CSU Sacramento, pursuing a degree in computer engineering.

I'm a freshman at the California Institute of Technology, majoring in Bioengineering and minoring in Computer Science. I love the thrill of successful debugging and I'm amazed by the potential artificial intelligence holds for the future. I'm also passionate about writing, Girls in STEM, and Naruto.
I am currently a Senior at Sacramento State majoring in Computer Engineering. I enjoy teaching engineering and programming to K-12.

curriculumParagraphs.title: Our Curriculum
paragraphs: Our 3-year plan is designed to get students excited about coding by exposing them to a variety of coding languages in which they can create projects that come to life with each computer keystroke. While creating websites, animated drawings and action games they’ll also be learning the key coding concepts that are universal across all coding languages. In addition, our courses are geared to improve the student’s critical and computational thinking skills and also to lay the groundwork in providing them with the competitive edge for colleges and jobs.

courses.name: Web Coding I
courses.description: Web Coding I introduces students to HTML & CSS. Students will learn how to build the structure of a webpage, import text, add images, create links, and then how to add style to their webpage with color, borders, creative fonts and so much more.

courses.name: Web Coding II
courses.description: In Web Coding II, students will create multiple webpages and learn how to link those webpages together to create their very own website! They'll learn how to create and add tabs, buttons, search bars, sidebars, sign-up pages and more. They'll be designing their own 'business' from record labels to pet stores to major league baseball teams and then once they've created a website for their 'company', they'll learn how to host their websites online for free!

courses.name: Javascript I
courses.description: In JS I, students will learn how to draw robots and make them move... all by writing code! To do this, they’ll learn how to navigate the text editor, JS Fiddle; how to use pixels and processing; what booleans are and how to code using variables, loops, conditionals and logical operators.

courses.name: Javascript II
courses.description: In JS II, students will take their drawings and animations to the next level while learning to code using functions, loops, arrays and objects.

courses.name: 3-D Game Development
courses.description: 3-D Game Development is our most popular and interactive course! Students will learn the fundamental tools of Unity and how to navigate its sophisticated software environment. By the end of the course, they will have a fully functional 3-D game. This alone will tremendously improve your child’s coding proficiency. Unity is the industry standard software used by all professional game developers.
